events.description: Gold dropped more than 2% to around $4,840 per ounce on Thursday.
President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair.
Planned nuclear talks between US and Iran in Oman on Friday.
Gold surged more than 6% earlier in the week, the largest intraday rise since 2008.

facts.fact_text: Gold dropped more than 2% to around $4,840 per ounce on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: Gold dropped more than 2% to around $4,840 per ounce on Thursday

facts.fact_text: Fed Governor Lisa Cook stated she would not support additional rate cuts.

evidences.evidence_text: Fed Governor Lisa Cook said she would not support additional cuts

facts.fact_text: Donald Trump nominated Kevin Warsh for the position of Fed chair.

evidences.evidence_text: President Trump’s nomination of Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair

claims.claim_text: Kevin Warsh is perceived as more hawkish than other candidates for Fed chair.
claims.author: Market participants

evidences.evidence_text: seen as more hawkish than other contenders

claims.claim_text: Markets are pricing in a slower pace of potential interest rate cuts.
claims.author: Markets

evidences.evidence_text: led markets to price at a slower pace of potential rate cuts

claims.claim_text: Donald Trump believes the Federal Reserve will definitely cut rates again.
claims.author: Donald Trump

evidences.evidence_text: sees little doubt the Fed will cut rates again

claims.claim_text: The US government has not dismissed the possibility of military strikes against Iran.
claims.author: Washington

evidences.evidence_text: with Washington not ruling out strikes

evidence.evidence_text: Gold dropped more than 2%... pressured by renewed selling after Federal Reserve caution on rate cuts
nomination of Kevin Warsh... led markets to price at a slower pace of potential rate cuts
prioritizing persistent upside inflation risks over signs of a slowing labor market
US–Iran tensions lingered despite plans for nuclear talks in Oman on Friday, with Washington not ruling out strikes
